resources.string:
National capital state, New Delhi standing on the west bank of Yamuna river has got the spell to charm locals and travelers alike. Heritage lovers have Humayun’s Tomb, Qutub Complex, Old Fort, Red Fort and other historic marvels carved by the maharajahs. Shopaholics have a real reason to loosen the pockets; Palika, Sarojini Nagar, Lajpat Nagar etc. Delhi’s India Gate, Supreme Court, Lotus Temple and Jama Masjid have set a new parameter in the brilliance of architecture. 

Delhi is fit for budget travelers, luxury travelers, kids and solo backpackers. 
Delhi is also called "Dilli Dilwalon ki" meaning Delhi belongs to the large-hearted. 

Languages: Hindi,English,Punjabi
Best time to visit: October to March
STD Code: 011-
Landmark of 17th-century Mughal fortress built in towering red sandstone, now a complex of museums.
All days of the week except Monday\n09:30 AM - 04:30 PM
Netaji Subhash Marg, Lal Qila, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi 110006, India
Official home of the president, located at the Western end of Rajpath in New Delhi. One of the largest residencies of head of state in the world.
All weekdays except public Holidays\n09:30 AM - 05:30 PM
Rashtrapati Bhawan, President\'s Estate, New Delhi, Delhi 110004, India
War Memorial located astride the Rajpath on the eastern edge of New Delhi, India, formerly called Kingsway.
All days of the week\n05:00 AM - 12:00 AM
Rajpath Marg, India Gate, New Delhi, Delhi 110001, India
